issues.description: The public method singFarmSong() is specified in the problem statement and present in the template as a void method that prints the song, but the solution implements singFarmSong() to return a String (instead of void) and does not print directly. This is a signature/return-type mismatch for a core API method students are asked to implement and will confuse readers about whether the method should print to System.out or return the song text.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the solution's public API match the specification/template. Change the solution's singFarmSong() to have return type void and print the song (System.out.println) as described in the problem statement. If returning the song string is desired for testing, add an additional helper (e.g. getFarmSongString()) and keep singFarmSong() as void that prints the helper's result.

issues.description: The helper method singFarmSongVerse is shown in the UML/problem as taking an Animal parameter (singFarmSongVerse(animal: Animal):void), and the solution implements singFarmSongVerse(Animal) returning a String. The template stub declares singFarmSongVerse with no parameter (the parameter is commented out). This mismatch in parameter presence between template and solution/problem can confuse students about the intended signature.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the signature across artifacts. Update the template's singFarmSongVerse stub to include the Animal parameter (private void singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal)) to match the UML/spec. Then implement it either to print directly or (see previous suggestion) return a String consistently across artifacts.

issues.description: The problem/template specify singFarmSongVerse as void (a printing helper) while the solution implements singFarmSongVerse to return a String. This return-type difference for the helper method creates inconsistency about whether verses should be printed in place or composed and returned.
issues.suggested_fix: Choose one consistent approach and apply it to all artifacts. Either (A) make singFarmSongVerse return void and print the verse directly (update solution accordingly), or (B) document in the problem statement/template that singFarmSong() and singFarmSongVerse() return Strings (and update template signatures). The least disruptive fix is to update the solution so singFarmSongVerse is private void singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal) and prints the verse; optionally keep a separate helper that returns a String for tests.
